required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Niraparib for the Neoadjuvant Treatment of Unresectable Ovarian Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Niraparib for the Neoadjuvant Treatment of Unresectable Ovarian Cancer

collaborator.agency: Obstetrics and Gynecology Hospital of Zhejiang University
First Affiliated Hospital of Suzhou Medical College

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, interventional, single-arm, open-label, phase II study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of niraparib monotherapy as neoadjuvant therapy in patients with advanced ovarian cancer, primary peritoneal cancer, fallopian tube cancer ((FIGO stage III or IV), who can not achieve R0 tumor reduction surgery after imaging evaluation or laparoscopic evaluation or can not tolerate surgery.

primary_outcome.description: the percentage of patients received R0 resection after Niraparib neoadjuvant treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall Response Rate (ORR) After Neoadjuvant treatment
primary_outcome.description: Overall Response Rate according to RECIST1.1 after Neoadjuvant treatment. ORR is defined as the proportion of participants achieving Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) as assessed by the investigator per RECIST (v.1.1). Per RECIST 1.1, CR is defined as the disappearance of all target lesions; PR is defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of diameters (SoD) of target lesions.

secondary_outcome.description: Disease control rate is defined as the proportion of participants achieving Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR) or Stable Disease (SD) according to RECIST1.1 and CA125 according to GCIC guidelines
Complete pathologic response rate is measured according to Miller-Panye system.

PFS is defined as the time in months from the date of first study drug administration to the date of first documentation of progressive disease (PD) or death as assessed by the Investigator per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1.
Overall survival. OS is defined as the time from the study enrollment to death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life (QOL) measures using Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy (FACT- ovarian cancer)
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate quality of life (QOL) for the subjects undergoing this treatment, using validated tools. QOL will be assessed every 3 months during treatment course. [Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - Ovarian Cancer questionnaire (score range from 0 to 160. Higher scores represent better quality of life.
life quality assessment. EQ-VAS, EuroQol-visual analogue scales. Score range from 0 [worse outcome] to 10 [better outcome]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of treatment interruption and termination
secondary_outcome.description: The rate of treatment interruption and termination caused by patients' intolerance of treatment side effects and other reasons;

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v5.0
secondary_outcome.description: To further describe safety and assess toxicities encountered with the use of the proposed treatment regimen in patients with stage III, all stage IV ovarian cancer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Response Rate (ORR) during niraparib maintain treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Overall Response Rate according to RECIST1.1 during niraparib maintain treatment. ORR is defined as the proportion of participants achieving Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) as assessed by the investigator per RECIST (v.1.1). Per RECIST 1.1, CR is defined as the disappearance of all target lesions; PR is defined as at least a 30% decrease in the sum of diameters (SoD) of target lesions.

arm_group.description: Niraparib was used in patients with newly diagnosed ovarian cancer before any treatment. The daily dose (e.g. 200 mg is 2 capsules of 100 mg) should be strictly controlled according to the experimental design.

intervention.description: Niraparib was used as 100mg capsules once a day since cycle 1 / day 1. The daily dose (e.g. 200 mg is 2 capsules of 100 mg) should be strictly controlled according to the experimental design. Patients should take medicine regularly every day under the guidance of doctors (the best in the morning). The patient must swallow all the capsules completely and do not chew the capsules. You may drink water or eat when taking medicine.
